title.narrative: CHILD CARE SYSTEM STRENGTHENING AND CCTE/CP

description.narrative: By 2020, the national child protection system (including the social service workforce) have increased capacity to expand the coverage and quality of the child protection services for vulnerable children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the national child protection system (including the social service workforce) have increased capacity to expand thecoverage and quality of the child protection services for vulnerable children

description.narrative: The quality and coverage of statutory child protection, PSS response, and family strengthening programmes were expanded, and standards of care for children at risk and deprived of parental care were enhanced. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2021

title.narrative: Social welfare workforce strengthened and connected to social protection system (case management, referral capacity development), Text

baseline.value: 0 - No connection between social welfare workforce and social protection system (as of mid-2017)

target.value: 2020:2 – Strong connection between social welfare workforce and social protection system.

actual.value: 2020:Weak connection between social welfare workforce and social protection system is established

title.narrative: of refugee and host community children assessed for protection needs by State-coordinated outreach teams(63853), Text
An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country (23-03-L3-01), Text

baseline.value: No Alternative care policies in line with the 2009 Guidelines exist but its implementation is fragmented. Current policies address the needs of children with specific vulnerabilities to a very limited extent only. In addition, review mechanisms and monito

target.value: 2020:Partially - BY 2020: Alternative care options are strengthened for children with disabilities. The testing period for the establishment of the emergency foster care system is in place. PSS Services for UASC improved.

actual.value: 2020:Alternatives for CWDs: Specialized foster care training programme for CWD was developed and 2000 Foster Families have started to be trained by MoFLSS trainers. REsidential alternative care, including PSS for UASC: Child Development and Support Program fo

title.narrative: Child Protection System has both preventative and responsive services available and there is a framework for coordination(63854), Text

baseline.value: Some components of the CP system across the continuum of care are in place

actual.value: 2020:2020: 15 operational state led service centres in 15 provinces.
